events.title: Trump’s shadow war in Venezuela grows, but country’s strongman leader still clings to power
events.description: Report of a drone attack on a port facility signals new phase in US military campaign against Nicolás Maduro US wargames played out scenarios for Maduro’s fall. None of them ended well for Venezuela Nearly a week after Donald Trump first announced what he said was the first US ground strike in a four-month-long military pressure campaign against Venezuela , details remain very thin on the ground. CNN and the New York Times reported late on Monday that they had confirmed the CIA had used a drone to target a “port facility” allegedly used by the Tren de Aragua street gang. No casualties were reported, but the date, time and location of the attack remain unknown. Venezuela’s strongman leader, Nicolás Maduro , and his government have remained silent. If confirmed, the first strike on land would mark a new phase in a campaign that since August has involved the deployment of a massive US naval fleet, airstrikes that have so far killed 107 people, a “total blockade” of sanctioned oil tankers, the seizure of two vessels and the pursuit of a third. Continue reading...

events.title: Looking back at 2025 - in satellite images
events.description: An earthquake, wildfires, war and a funeral are among the world events that satellite images have helped Sky News cover this year.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s camp confirm two of his close friends died in Nigeria car crash
events.description: British former boxing champion sustained minor injuries Sina Ghami and Kevin ‘Lateef’ Ayodel killed in accident The British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua has issued a statement after he was injured in a car crash in Nigeria on Monday morning which killed two of his close friends. The former world heavyweight boxing champion was taken to an undisclosed hospital after his car hit a stationary vehicle at about 11am on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, the Ogun state police commissioner, Lanre Ogunlowo, said. The driver of Joshua’s vehicle was also injured, he added. Continue reading...

events.title: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan simulating blockade of major ports
events.description: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning’ against separatist and external forces China has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan. The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – sent its navy, air force, rocket force and coastguard to surround Taiwan on Monday morning for a surprise exercise called “Justice Mission 2025”, which began less than an hour after it was announced. Continue reading...

events.title: UN, US sign $2 billion humanitarian funding agreement for 17 crisis-hit countries
events.description: The United Nations and the United States on Monday formalized an agreement under which the US committed $2 billion in humanitarian assistance for global relief programmes, a move the UN’s top relief official hailed as a landmark commitment to saving lives amid escalating humanitarian needs worldwide.

events.title: Hamas confirms five leaders killed, including 'masked spokesperson' in major blow to terror group
events.description: Five Hamas military commanders confirmed dead by terrorist group's armed wing, marking significant blow to Palestinian militant organization's leadership structure in Gaza conflict.

events.title: Sudan civil war: Health system ‘on the verge of collapse’
events.description: The war in Sudan has been tearing the country apart for almost 1,000 days, putting the country’s health system under intolerable pressure. The World Health Organization (WHO) is reporting widespread disease outbreaks, severe shortages, malnutrition and rising deaths.

events.title: Man dead and teenage boy feared missing after boat capsizes off northern Sydney beach
events.description: One man rescued by helicopter after accident near Barrenjoey headland on Palm beach Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A man has died, a 14-year-old boy is feared missing and another man has been rescued after a boat capsized in waters off a northern Sydney’s beach on Wednesday. In a statement on Wednesday afternoon, NSW police said emergency services were called about 11.35am to Palm beach, after reports that a boat had capsized near Barrenjoey headland, about 40km from the Sydney CBD. Continue reading...

events.title: Turkey arrests 357 people in operation against Islamic State group
events.description: Turkey said it arrested 357 people on Tuesday linked to the Islamic State group, following intelligence reports that the terrorist organisation was "planning attacks" during Christmas and New Year.

events.title: Syria: Guterres deplores deadly mosque blast in Homs
events.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres “unequivocally condemns” the deadly terrorist attack on a mosque in Homs, Syria during Friday prayers, his spokesperson said in a statement

events.title: Africa’s Christian Crisis: How 2025’s deadly attacks finally drew global attention after Trump’s intervention
events.description: Christian communities in Africa reportedly under siege as Islamist groups target churches and believers across multiple countries during Christmas 2025.

events.title: Australian police find no evidence of 'broader terrorist cell' in Bondi Beach antisemitic shooting
events.description: Police say an investigation that extended to the Philippines of two men accused of killing 15 people at a Sydney Jewish festival has found no evidence they were part of a “broader terrorist cell.”

events.title: Hamas builds new terror regime in Gaza, recruiting teens amid problematic election
events.description: Hamas is recruiting teenage fighters during Gaza ceasefire after Israeli forces withdrew in October. This as national security analyst Professor Kobi Michael warns about growing militant control.

events.title: At least 13 people killed and 98 injured in train derailment in Mexico
events.description: Train accident in Oaxaca is likely to raise criticisms about public works projects from the previous administration At least 13 people were killed when a train derailed in the Mexican state of Oaxaca, in an accident which is likely to revive opposition criticisms of the speed and dealings with which the country’s government builds its flagship public works projects. The incident took place on the Interoceanic Train, which was built to link the Atlantic and Pacific oceans across the narrowest part of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec, creating an alternative rail cargo route to the Panama canal intended to drive development in the region. Continue reading...

events.title: UN chief urges world leaders to ‘get priorities straight’ as New Year message calls for peace over war
events.description: As the world enters 2026 amid mounting crises, the UN Secretary-General António Guterres has issued a stark but hopeful New Year appeal, urging global leaders to shift resources away from destruction and towards development, peace and people.

events.title: Sri Lanka cyclone: More than a million still need aid weeks after Ditwah floods
events.description: Nearly a month after Cyclone Ditwah tore across Sri Lanka, more than a million people – including over half a million children – remain in urgent need of humanitarian assistance, as floods, landslides and renewed rainfall continue to compound one of the country’s worst disasters in decades.

events.title: Key viewing spots for Sydney fireworks reach capacity as city urged to celebrate first New Year’s Eve since Bondi attack
events.description: NSW premier Chris Minns encourages Sydneysiders to ‘puff out your chest’, stating police on ‘high alert’ as more than 1 million people expected to celebrate in the city Guide to New Year’s Eve fireworks and events in Australia’s capital cities Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Thousands of people have taken up key vantage points for New Year’s Eve fireworks, with Chris Minns asking Sydneysiders to “square your shoulders, puff out your chest and walk out” to celebrate as a show of defiance after the Bondi attack. Key viewing sites, including at Mrs Macquarie’s Chair and other areas in the Royal Botanic Garden, were already at capacity on Wednesday afternoon. Continue reading...

events.title: Brown University implements campus-wide security overhaul after mass shooting leaves 2 dead, 9 wounded
events.description: Brown University announces new safety measures including security cameras after Dec. 13 mass shooting that killed two students in engineering building.

events.title: Iran reportedly developing chemical, biological missile warheads as protests spread over collapsing economy
events.description: As Netanyahu meets Trump, intelligence suggests Iran accelerating chemical weapons work while facing unprecedented domestic unrest and economic crisis.

events.title: Iran's pres. says answer to attack would be harsh in response to Trump warning
events.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian says his country’s answer to an attack would be harsh

events.title: California farming tycoon accused of fatally shooting wife through window amid fight over fortune: report
events.description: California farming tycoon charged with murdering estranged wife in Arizona home after cross-state investigation reveals evidence allegedly linking him to the shooting.

events.title: Nashville shooter Audrey Hale allegedly used federal student aid to buy guns for school attack
events.description: Audrey Elizabeth Hale used federal Pell Grant money to purchase firearms for Covenant School shooting in Nashville, according to newly released FBI records.

events.title: Why China is bringing out the big guns for military drills around Taiwan
events.description: China stepped up its military drills around Taiwan with live-fire exercises on Tuesday, the second day of an operation dubbed “Justice Mission 2025". The massive show of force comes at a crucial time as Beijing seeks to capitalise on domestic political tensions in Taiwan and issue a warning to foreign powers supporting Taipei.

events.title: Afghanistan to remain major crisis in 2026, UN, partners warn
events.description: Afghanistan is expected to remain one of the world’s largest humanitarian crises in 2026, UN agencies and humanitarian partners warned on Tuesday, launching a $1.7 billion appeal to assist nearly 18 million people in urgent need.

events.title: UN peacekeeper injured in gunfire near ‘Blue Line’ in south Lebanon
events.description: One United Nations peacekeeper was injured on Friday after heavy machine gunfire from Israel Defense Forces (IDF) positions south of the Blue Line, following a nearby grenade explosion, impacted close to a UN patrol in southern Lebanon.

events.title: 2025 Most Memorable Heartwarming Moments: December 30, 2025
events.description: Choose between Robert Irwin winning Dancing with the Stars, the Nation raising money and supporting LA after the wildfires, or the Election of Pope Leo XIV.

events.title: Syria arrests suspects in Latakia after sectarian violence, curfew imposed
events.description: Syrian authorities have arrested 21 people in the coastal province of Latakia over alleged links to the ousted government of Bashar al-Assad, state media reported, after sectarian violence prompted an overnight curfew in the provincial capital.

events.title: SECURITY COUNCIL LIVE: Briefing on threats to international peace and security
events.description: The UN Security Council meets today to hear a briefing on threats to international peace and security following Israel’s recent recognition of the northern region of Somalia as an independent and sovereign state. Follow live below and UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Thousands of Somalis protest against Israel's recognition of Somaliland
events.description: In tonight's edition, the largest ever protests against Israel's recognition of Somaliland are organised across Somalia. Also, a blown tyre and high speed are behind the accident that left boxer Anthony Joshua just injured in a Nigerian hospital. And Abuja ends the year still unpicking the complex ramifications of the US’s airstrikes on alleged extremist camps in Nigeria’s northwest.

events.title: How climate change is threatening human rights
events.description: With rising effects of climate change across the globe, the world has started recognising that climate change is not just an ecological collapse, but also a human rights crisis.

events.title: Industrialisation without destruction: A UN blueprint for the future
events.description: Since the 19th century, industrialisation has had a transformative effect on the world, both positive and negative. It has created jobs and lifted millions out of poverty. But it has also had devastating consequences; destroying ecosystems, polluting the air, and driving the climate crisis that threatens to make large parts of the planet uninhabitable.

events.title: Iranian protesters clash with security forces as tear gas fills Tehran streets amid nationwide unrest
events.description: Iran protests escalated as demonstrators clashed with security forces in Tehran and Mashhad, with tear gas deployed amid nationwide strikes, reports say.

events.title: Trump vows to 'knock the hell out of' Iran if nuclear program is rebuilt again after high-stakes meeting
events.description: Trump warns Iran he'll 'knock the hell out of them' if nuclear program rebuilds, as new reports allegedly detail chemical weapons development for missiles.

events.title: Anthony Joshua injured in Nigeria car crash that killed two team members
events.description: The British heavyweight boxer suffered minor injuries in the crash, which killed two team members and close friends.

events.title: Trump ‘not worried’ as China’s live-fire Taiwan wargame enters second day
events.description: US president says Chinese leader did not notify him of drills that have involved live missile launches into Taiwan strait Taiwan-China tensions – explained in 30 seconds Donald Trump has said he is not worried by China’s live-fire military drills surrounding Taiwan and that he has a great relationship with the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, who “hasn’t told me anything about it”. The US president’s comments came amid a large two-day surprise attack simulation launched by the People’s Liberation Army (PLA) on Monday and Tuesday, which China has called “Justice Mission 2025”. Continue reading...

events.title: Two trains carrying tourists to Machu Picchu crash - as one person killed
events.description: At least one person has been killed and around 30 passengers have been injured after two trains taking tourists to Machu Picchu in Peru crashed.

events.title: UN renews ceasefire push in Sudan
events.description: The UN has urged Sudan’s warring parties to pursue compromise and an immediate ceasefire, even as drone attacks, displacement and the killing of peacekeepers underscore the growing risks to civilians and humanitarians.

events.title: Anti-Iran regime protests grow across country as Trump admin boosts demonstrators offering support
events.description: U.S. officials voice support for Iranian demonstrators as protests intensify following currency crisis, with reports of tear gas and security crackdowns.

events.title: Nigeria: Can US airstrikes weaken Islamist militants?
events.description: Details remain sparse on the effectiveness of the United States' airstrikes on Islamist militants in Nigeria last week. However, the event signals a shift in US-Nigeria cooperation on fighting terror.

events.title: Russia's nuclear-capable Oreshnik missiles have entered active service, Moscow says
events.description: Russia’s nuclear-capable Oreshnik missile system has entered active service, Russia’s Ministry of Defense says, as negotiators continue to search for a breakthrough in peace talks to end Moscow’s war in Ukraine

events.title: Missing elderly person found in bitter cold woods after police deploy thermal imaging drone
events.description: Philadelphia police rescued a missing elderly person from a wooded area Sunday using thermal imaging drone technology in coordinated search effort.

events.title: ‘Only Trump can stop Russia’: Millions face freezing winter, Ukraine energy executive warns
events.description: Ukraine's largest private energy company reports 90% of generation capacity damaged by Russian attacks, leaving over 1 million without power during freezing temperatures.

events.title: The 'thorny' issues that threaten to derail a Russia-Ukraine peace deal
events.description: Two of the main sticking points involve territory and the fate of Europe's biggest nuclear plant, which is currently occupied by Russia.

events.title: What challenges does the world economy face in 2026?
events.description: From trade tensions and high debt burdens to fears of an AI stocks bubble, the global economy will face an array of risks that could dampen growth in the new year.

events.title: UAE to withdraw forces from Yemen amid crisis with Saudi Arabia
events.description: The UAE said Tuesday it would withdraw its remaining forces from Yemen after Saudi Arabia led an airstrike on a southern Yemeni port targeting what it said was a UAE-linked weapons shipment. Following the strike, Saudi Arabia backed calls for UAE forces to leave the country within 24 hours.

events.title: Syrian authorities impose curfew in Latakia as violence surges
events.description: Cars and shops were vandalised during attacks on Alawite neighbourhoods in the city.

events.title: Influx of cheap Chinese imports could drive down UK inflation, economists say
events.description: As Trump’s tariffs take effect, Britain is likely alternative destination for cars, telecoms and sound equipment Business live – latest updates The UK is poised for an influx of cheap Chinese imports that could bring down inflation amid the fallout from Donald Trump’s global trade war, leading economists have said. After figures showed China’s trade surplus surpassed $1tn (£750bn) despite Washington’s tariff policies hitting exports to the US, the Bank of England said the UK was among the nations emerging as alternative destinations for the goods. Continue reading...

events.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of attempted drone strike, threatens to harden peace stance
events.description: Russia says Ukraine tried to hit one of Putin's homes with a drone. Kyiv denies it, calling the claim staged to justify war. The Kremlin now warns it may toughen its stance in the ongoing peace talks.

events.title: Germany news: Fireworks back on sale, reignite ban debate
events.description: Germany's perennial debate over safety has flared up once again as fireworks sales resume ahead of New Year. Meanwhile, a spate of black ice has caused numerous accidents across the country. Follow our updates.

events.title: UAE to withdraw ‘counterterrorism’ units from Yemen after Saudi-led strike
events.description: The UAE says it’s withdrawing all ‘counterterrorism’ units from Yemen after a Saudi-led coalition launched air strikes.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Tonga is not a threat’: anger as small Pacific nation falls under Trump visa restrictions
events.description: Community leaders raise alarm over study links and Polynesian ties, with Tonga to face restrictions from January as US says too many overstay The small Pacific nation of Tonga is one of more than a dozen countries to be hit with visa and entry restrictions on 1 January as the Trump administration tightens its crackdown on immigration. In December , the US said it would further restrict and limit the entry of foreign nationals to protect the country from “national security and public safety threats”. Continue reading...

events.title: George and Amal Clooney become French after naturalisation process
events.description: US actor and British-Lebanese international human rights lawyer George and Amal Clooney have become French citizens after they were naturalised with their two children. The family bought a house on a vineyard in the south of France in 2021 and have become involved in the local life. The naturalisation of the Clooneys comes as some Americans, including a number of celebrities, are seeking citizenship in European nations, partially motivated by the Trump administration.

events.title: Sexual violence against children ‘entrenched, systemic and widespread’ across DR Congo, UNICEF warns
events.description: Sexual violence against children has become entrenched, systemic and increasingly widespread across the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with new data showing a sharp rise in cases since 2022, according to the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

events.title: Judge halts Homeland Security plan to end Temporary Protected Status for South Sudan
events.description: A federal judge temporarily blocked DHS from ending TPS for South Sudan, preserving legal status for hundreds amid ongoing conflict concerns.

events.title: Turkey detains 357 suspected IS members in nationwide raids
events.description: The arrests come just a day after three police officers were killed during a siege in the town of Yalova.

events.title: Turkiye’s Erdogan calls Israel’s Somaliland recognition ‘unacceptable’
events.description: Somali President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud has accused Israel of violating international law and of 'illegal aggression'.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Central African Republic goes to polls as president seeks third term
events.description: Opposition hopes to tap into frustrations of people living in country where conflict remains a daily reality Central African Republic goes to the polls on Sunday with the president, Faustin-Archange Touadéra, seeking a third term. As many as 2.3 million registered voters will cast ballots for what observers are calling a quadruple election: votes for the presidency and parliament as well as local and municipal offices. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuela says it released 99 people detained for 2024 election protests
events.description: Government said the move was due to its ‘unrestricted respect for human rights’ in the face of US aggression Venezuela has said it has carried out its largest release of political prisoners this year, claiming to have freed 99 people detained for taking part in protests after the 2024 election, widely believed to have been stolen by the dictator Nicolás Maduro , as it comes under increasing military pressure from the US. Civil society organisations have treated the news with caution and stressed that the releases were insufficient, noting that at least 900 political prisoners remain in the country. Continue reading...

events.title: A professor breaks down Russia's negotiating tactics with Ukraine
events.description: Nina Khrushcheva, professor of International Affairs at New York's New School, talks about the negotiating tactics Russia is using in peace talks with Ukraine.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Russia says hit by drone attack
events.description: Russia said its air defenses shot down drones over the Moscow region, parts of western Russia and the occupied Crimean Peninsula. Meanwhile, a power outage hit a town outside the capital, Moscow. Follow DW for more.

events.title: An escalation in Yemen threatens to reignite civil war and widen tensions in the Gulf
events.description: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later said it would withdraw its forces from Yemen.

events.title: Sudan defying war to bring joy at AFCON 2025
events.description: A brutal civil war has been raging in Sudan since 2023. The national football team is participating in the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco with more than just sporting success in mind.

events.title: Machu Picchu train crash leaves one dead and dozens injured
events.description: A train driver died and at least 40 people were injured in the crash on the single-track line to Machu Picchu.

events.title: Trump hopes to reach phase two of Gaza ceasefire 'very quickly'
events.description: The US president also warns Hamas will have "hell to pay" if it does not disarm, after talks with Netanyahu.

events.title: UAE says it will withdraw from Yemen after Saudi strike on separatist-held port
events.description: The UAE and Saudi have been allies in the war against the Houthis, but infighting between the rival factions they support has caused a rift between them.

events.title: Train crash near Peru’s Machu Picchu kills driver, injures dozens
events.description: Train conductor killed in collision on rail line serving the famed archaeological site, authorities say.

events.title: The UAE denies shipping weapons to Yemen after overnight Saudi strike
events.description: In an overnight strike, the Saudi military hit a Yemeni port saying they were neutralising a weapons shipments arriving from UAE and meant for the STC separatist group. The UAE has denied the shipment contained weapons and claimed the vehicles were not intended for any groups. Both countries have supported the fighting sides in the over-decade long war in Yemen, but this strike has turned this rivalry into an open dispute.

events.title: China fires rockets into waters off Taiwan in second day of military drills
events.description: China has fired rockets into the waters off Taiwan on a second day of large-scale war games around the island aimed at rehearsing a blockade.

events.title: Key dates in Taiwan’s history: A contested island's evolution
events.description: China has been staging live-fire military drills around Taiwan featuring aircraft, warships and rocket launches

events.title: Body found during search for missing Texas teen Camila Mendoza Olmos as another teen girl disappears
events.description: Texas authorities find body and firearm during search for 19-year-old Camila Olmos who vanished Christmas Eve from Bexar County in ongoing case.

events.title: China launches largest military drills off Taiwan in 8 months with live-fire exercises caught on camera
events.description: China launches biggest military encirclement of Taiwan in 8 months with live-fire drills, rockets and warships in massive 'Justice Mission 2025' exercise.

events.title: U.S. announces more military actions against ISIS: 'We will not relent'
events.description: CENTCOM declared that the U.S. and partner forces in Syria killed and captured ISIS figures in the time since a December 19 strike in Syria.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: M 6.0 - 2025 Taitung, Taiwan Earthquake
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - VII DYFI? - VI Time 2025-12-24 09:47:06 UTC 2025-12-24 09:47:06 UTC at epicenter Location 22.851°N 121.207°E Depth 10.00 km (6.21 mi)

events.title: UK PM Starmer–praised Egyptian extremist faces counter-terror probe over resurfaced tweets
events.description: U.K. counterterrorism police assess controversial social media posts by Egyptian-British activist after his return to Britain sparked political backlash.

events.title: UAE to withdraw forces from Yemen after Saudi strike
events.description: The UAE said it was withdrawing voluntarily after Yemen's Saudi-backed presidential council canceled a defense pact with the UAE and asked its forces to leave the country within 24 hours.

events.title: Eurostar suspends 'all trains' between London and Europe
events.description: Eurostar suspended services in the ⁠tunnel that links Britain and continental Europe. The company warned earlier of disruptions due to an overhead power supply issue.

events.title: Iran protests spread to students on third day
events.description: The drop in value in Iran's rial and the country getting close to hyperinflation has increased the cost of living for many Iranians. After shopkeepers started protesting on December 28, Iranian students joined in on December 30. The protests are the biggest the country has known since the 'Woman, Life, Freedom' movement in 2022. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle tells us more.

events.title: Iranian university students join protests over soaring cost of living
events.description: University students in Iran have joined shopkeepers and bazaar merchants in protests over the country's soaring cost of living.

events.title: Sudan: UN warns of unprecedented child hunger in Darfur as fighting fuels refugee exodus
events.description: Sudan’s deepening war is driving unprecedented levels of hunger, child malnutrition and displacement, UN agencies report, as new data from Darfur and a renewed refugee influx into Chad underscore the rapidly deteriorating situation.

events.title: Gaza battered by heavy rains as humanitarian response continues
events.description: Severe weather conditions have led to further casualties and heightened health risks in Gaza over the past 24 hours, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) reported on Monday.

events.title: Is the US economy strong heading into 2026? The picture is complicated
events.description: The world's top economy is growing faster than its peers, but divide between wealthy and poorer Americans is growing.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Trump, Netanyahu meet over ceasefire. And, Russia accuses Ukraine of attempted strike
events.description: Conditions are dire for people in Gaza as President Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss the next phase of the ceasefire deal. And, Russia accuses Ukraine of an attempted drone strike.

events.title: Morning news brief
events.description: Trump and Israel's prime minister discuss next phase of Gaza peace plan, Russia threatens to harden stance in peace talks after accusing Ukraine attempted strike, the impact of DOGE in 2025.

events.title: Syria imposes curfew in port city after sectarian violence
events.description: Syrian authorities announced a 13-hour curfew and said the arrest of 21 members of the Alawite community in Latakia. The city is a bastion of Syria's Alawite minority, of which former President Bashar Assad was part.

events.title: Turkey detains 357 suspects after 'Islamic State' clashes
events.description: Turkish police have made hundreds of arrests in nationwide raids against suspected "Islamic State" networks. The sweep followed hours-long street fighting that left police and militants dead.

events.title: Cyprus back at the helm of EU Council presidency
events.description: After 14 years, Cyprus takes over the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union on January 1. It will lead during a politically sensitive moment, and aims to shape the EU's role on the global stage.

events.title: Miners clash with police in Bolivia as protests over fuel subsidies enter second week
events.description: Bolivian miners have set off dynamite and launched fireworks at police during protests against economic reforms by President Rodrigo Paz

events.title: First Person: Felipe Paullier, the youngest ever senior UN official, charged with giving a voice to young people around the world
events.description: A paediatrician by training, Felipe Paullier has long been an advocate for youth. Formerly Director of the Uruguayan Government's Youth Institute, a role which involved several joint actions with various UN agencies, he was appointed to run the UN Youth Office in 2023, the youngest senior appointment in United Nations history.

events.title: Paper and wood: Forest products show signs of recovery, UN agency says
events.description: From wood-based panels used in construction, to charcoal for cooking food, forest products are valued and traded all around the world.

events.title: Feds launch 'massive operation' in Minnesota amid fraud scandal
events.description: Federal authorities launched a massive operation in Minnesota targeting fraud suspects in a major crackdown on criminal activity across the state Tuesday.

events.title: Russia's losses in Ukraine rise faster than ever as US pushes for peace deal
events.description: A steep rise in soldiers' obituaries is documented by the BBC as part of its work in counting Russian war losses.

events.title: Ukraine denies drone attack on Putin's residence
events.description: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,406
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,406 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Israel to block dozens of aid groups working in war-battered Gaza
events.description: Aid groups facing bans include MSF and Oxfam as European countries sound the alarm over dire humanitarian situation.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Germany: Merz says 2026 can be a 'year of new beginnings'
events.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz touched on war in Ukraine, increased defense spending, changing ties to the US, technological upheaval, industrial stagnation, sluggish reforms, migration and more in his New Year's address.

events.title: Congo president Sassou Nguesso to seek re-election in March 2026
events.description: Congo is heading towards another tightly watched presidential race after the ruling Congolese Labour Party confirmed it will again back veteran leader Denis Sassou Nguesso, extending the 82-year-old’s decades-long grip on power into a 2026 election already drawing opposition scrutiny.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot's funeral divides French politics: Le Pen to attend, Macron sits out
events.description: France's far-right leader Marine Le Pen will attend the screen legend Brigitte Bardot's funeral next week, but President Emmanuel Macron will not, their teams said on Tuesday. In her later years, Bardot was an outspoken supporter of the far right and was convicted in court for hate speech, stirring debate over whether or not France should give her the honour of a national farewell ceremony.

events.title: Danish post office delivers last letter, ending a 400-year run to adapt to the digital age
events.description: It's the end of an era for the Danish post office. Citing a 90% drop in letter-sending over the past quarter-century, PostNord has ended delivering paper letters in the country, a service first started in 1624. Plus, France is set to issue €310 billion in new sovereign bonds next year, a move that's set to complicate its effort to reduce its debt pile, already at over 117% of GDP.

events.title: Situation in Gaza is 'catastrophic’, foreign ministers from 10 countries warn
events.description: A group of 10 countries, including France, warned on Tuesday that the situation in Gaza was "catastrophic" due to the "renewed deterioration of the humanitarian situation" in the Palestinian enclave. They called on Israel to allow greater access for NGOs and to lift restrictions on importing essential medical and shelter equipment.

events.title: Leaders from Europe and Canada discuss US-led peace efforts as Russia-Ukraine tensions spike
events.description: Leaders from Europe and Canada have held talks on U.S.-led peace efforts to end the war between Russia and Ukraine

events.title: Missing Camila Mendoza Olmos: Dashcam captures last sighting of Texas teen who vanished Christmas Eve
events.description: Texas authorities release dashcam video showing missing 19-year-old Camila Mendoza Olmos walking alone on Christmas Eve, believed in imminent danger.

events.title: Armed Americans fight back: Inside 2025’s most gripping self-defense shootings across the US
events.description: Self-defense shootings made headlines across America in 2025. Texas donut shop owner, Virginia homeowner fight back against alleged armed robbers.

events.title: These crimes exposed America's deepest fractures and kept millions glued to their screens
events.description: The most gripping crime stories of 2025 included Charlie Kirk's assassination, an ISIS-inspired New Orleans attack and murder trials that revealed deep fractures in society.

events.title: Putin residence drone attack dismissed as ‘implausible’ as Ukraine accusations mount
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence allegedly targeted by Ukrainian drones, but drone expert Cameron Chell says the claims lack credibility due to tactical impossibilities.

events.title: Zelenskyy denies Russian claim that Ukraine attacked Putin residence
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calls alleged drone attack on Russian President Vladimir Putin's residence a "complete fabrication" as tensions escalate between Ukraine and Russia.

events.title: Trump meets with Zelenskyy; talks could unlock first Zelenskyy-Putin call in five years: source
events.description: President Donald Trump assumes mediator role as talks with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy focus on a U.S.-backed 20-point peace plan that could end the war in Ukraine.

events.title: UK flag clash as foreign banners fly, citizens push back against woke policies reshaping Britain
events.description: New polling reveals deep splits over Union Jack symbolism as Britain's changing demographics fuel heated debate about national flags and identity.

events.title: SoftBank to acquire DigitalBridge for $4bn in move to deepen ties to AI
events.description: Acquisition would further expand SoftBank’s investments in artificial intelligence as it tries to center itself in the boom SoftBank Group will acquire digital infrastructure investor DigitalBridge Group in a deal valued at $4bn, the companies said on Monday, as the Japanese investment firm looks to deepen its AI-related portfolio. The acquisition would expand SoftBank’s exposure to digital infrastructure as the Japanese conglomerate is positioning its portfolio to focus on artificial intelligence. SoftBank’s billionaire founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to capitalize on surging demand for the computing capacity that underpins artificial intelligence applications. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran: Students join economic protests, president seeks talks
events.description: Students demonstrated at several universities in Iran, semi-official media reported, after demos by shopkeepers and bazaar merchants moved the president to announce plans for talks with protesters online.

events.title: Almost half of all Germans want a ban on fireworks
events.description: In Germany, it is only permitted to sell fireworks in the three days leading up to New Year’s Eve. Some line up early to buy them, but others have safety concerns and want to see them banned altogether.

events.title: French right pushes for national tribute to film star Brigitte Bardot
events.description: A petition for a national homage to Brigitte Bardot - who died on Sunday - attracts more than 23,000 signatures.

events.title: Israel’s recognition of Somaliland ‘strange, unexpected’: Somali president
events.description: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud says his country believes the move is linked to Israel's plans to forcibly displace Palestinians.

events.title: Disney to pay $10m over alleged breaches of US child privacy laws
events.description: Settlement comes after US Federal Trade Commission accused entertainment giant of unlawfully collecting children's data

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Indian cinema: National pride meets box office success
events.description: A wave of Bollywood films reflecting the BJP government's narratives is reshaping Indian cinema and finding major commercial success.

events.title: Guinea coup leader Doumbouya elected president in provisional results
events.description: More than three years after taking power in a military coup, Guinea’s junta leader Mamady Doumbouya secured a sweeping election victory on Tuesday that cements his grip on the presidency, in a vote critics say was held in a tightly controlled political environment as the country seeks to draw a line under years of upheaval.

events.title: What's inside Mexico's Popocatépetl volcano? Scientists obtain first 3D images
events.description: Scientists from Mexico’s National Autonomous University have created the first three-dimensional image of the Popocatépetl volcano's interior

events.title: Mali and Burkina Faso impose retaliatory travel ban on US nationals
events.description: Mali and Burkina Faso have banned U.S. citizens from entering their countries

events.title: Russia sends 3 Iranian satellites into orbit, report says
events.description: Iran's state television says that Russia has sent three Iranian communications satellites into orbit

events.title: George Clooney ditches Hollywood culture for France, gains citizenship with wife and twins
events.description: George Clooney and wife Amal become French citizens with their twins, trading Hollywood glamor for peaceful farm life in the French countryside together.

events.title: Protests spread across Iran for third day after currency hits record low
events.description: The Iranian rial hit a record low against the US dollar on Sunday, prompting shopkeepers in Tehran to stage protests, which have quickly spread.

events.title: Thailand releases 18 Cambodian soldiers as ceasefire holds
events.description: Thailand hands over 18 soldiers after 155 days of captivity as truce agreed over the weekend continues to hold.

events.title: UAE to pull forces out of Yemen after calls for withdrawal, Saudi strike
events.description: Move comes after Riyadh accused Abu Dhabi of backing separatists in Yemen, a claim the UAE denies.

events.title: Arsenal crush Aston Villa in Premier League; Wolves hold Man United
events.description: Arsenal storm to 4-1 win against Aston Villa to strengthen EPL title credentials, but Man Utd limp against lowly Wolves.

events.title: US struck ‘big facility’ in Venezuela, Trump claimed without offering details
events.description: Trump alleged that US forces hit ‘very hard’ in what would mark his team’s first land strike on Venezuela if confirmed Donald Trump has claimed that US forces struck a “big facility” in Venezuela last week – but the president did not specify what it was, or where, and the White House has not commented further. “We just knocked out – I don’t know if you read or you saw – they have a big plant, or a big facility, where the ships come from. Two nights ago, we knocked that out. So we hit them very hard,” Trump told Republican donor and New York supermarket owner John Catsimatidis on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: China flexes blockade capabilities near Taiwan on second day of military drills
events.description: China's People's Liberation Army is staging a second day of large-scale military drills around Taiwan. It's unleashing live-fire exercises as part of what it calls "Justice Mission 2025."

events.title: Trump and Netanyahu meet to discuss next phase of Gaza ceasefire plan
events.description: Israel's prime minister met President Trump at the White House Monday to discuss next steps in the peace plan with Gaza and across the region.

events.title: Eurostar services gradually resuming after major power supply issue
events.description: Eurostar said on December 30 it was restarting services over a power supply problem in the Channel tunnel. Travellers were left scrambling to find alternatives after the operator postponed all services between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot spoke to some in Gare du Nord in Paris.

events.title: Anthony Joshua was 'shocked' and 'couldn't talk' after crash, eyewitness says
events.description: Boxer Anthony Joshua was "shocked" and "couldn't talk" after a car crash in Nigeria, according to an eyewitness.

events.title: Florida firefighters allegedly waterboarded, whipped rookie over TikTok video as 4 face criminal charges
events.description: Four Florida firefighters face criminal charges after allegedly waterboarding and whipping a 19-year-old rookie firefighter. Nearly a dozen employees fired.

events.title: Bear remains under California home after weeks of failed removal attempts
events.description: Bear trap in Altadena accidentally catches wrong animal as 550-pound black bear continues living under California home despite month-long removal efforts.

events.title: Wild video shows speeding car going airborne, ejects driver into backyard pool
events.description: Surveillance footage captures car crashing through Nevada home's backyard, ejecting female driver into pool.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Cheaper medicines, rules for cash and new state laws: what will change in Australia on 1 January?
events.description: Changes include the Victorian government expanding land taxes and Queensland introducing a child sex offender register Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Cheaper medicines on the PBS, a Medicare phone service and new laws mandating businesses to accept cash payments are just some of the major changes coming into effect in the first week of 2026. Indexation increases to social security payments, changes to childcare settings and a new online mental health service will also kick in from the beginning of January. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany: €30 million stolen in elaborate bank vault heist
events.description: Investigators have been piecing together how burglars drilled into a secure area from outside and ransacked thousands of safe-deposit boxes. Police say the evidence points to a highly organized operation.

events.title: Turkish police detain 357 suspects in raids against the Islamic State group
events.description: Turkish police have conducted large-scale operations against the Islamic State group across Turkey, detaining 357 suspects

events.title: Development cooperation agreement marks new phase in UN-Iraq partnership
events.description: Better access to education, the protection of the environment and good governance are some of the areas in which the United Nations helps countries improve.

events.title: State officials and daycare manager push back on viral video fraud allegations in Minnesota
events.description: Minnesota officials deny daycare fraud allegations after viral video questioned state-funded centers, sparking widespread controversy over taxpayer money usage.

events.title: 'No worries': Trump downplays Chinese military drills around Taiwan
events.description: The US President has downplayed the drills which follow a US announcement of an $11bn arms sale to Taiwan.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Eurostar: Hundreds of passengers stranded in stations
events.description: Eurostar suspended all trains between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels on Tuesday and advised passengers to postpone their journeys to a later date, citing a power supply problem in the Channel tunnel.

events.title: AFCON knockout race intensifies as groups C and D to wrap up
events.description: The Africa's Football Cup of Nations will see two group wrap up as Groups C and D teams play their last games in Morocco on December 30. Teams will be looking to qualify for the competition's round of 16, with Senegal being the big favourites alongside host nation Morocco. FRANCE 24's Selina Sykes reports directly from Rabat and tells us what to know ahead of the coming games.

events.title: Eurostar cancels all services after power issue
events.description: Eurostar suspended train services in Europe on December 30 after a power supply issue in the Channel tunnel, sparking travel chaos for passengers during the very busy New Year period. Its services to and from London “are suspended until further notice" and the company advised its passengers to rebook their journeys for other days. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot tells us more from Gare du Nord in Paris.

events.title: 41 young men die in South Africa from circumcision procedures during initiation ceremonies
events.description: Authorities report that at least 41 young men have died from circumcision procedures during traditional initiation activities in South Africa in November and December

events.title: Eurostar to resume services to and from London after 'major disruption' in Channel Tunnel forced cancellations
events.description: Eurostar suspends all London services due to major power supply issues in Channel Tunnel and failed LeShuttle train, forcing passengers to rebook journeys.

events.title: From Gaza to Iran: What’s at stake in Trump-Netanyahu Mar-a-Lago talks?
events.description: Gaza peace plan and Iran both reportedly on agenda as President Donald Trump is set to meet Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago on Monday.

events.title: A Filipino tribe fights to stay as a ‘Smart City’ rises on a former US base
events.description: Aetas race to prove ancestral land claims before a 'Smart City' and a 'Taylor Swift-ready' stadium displace them.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Saudi Arabia bombs Yemen over shipment of weapons that arrived from UAE
events.description: Saudi Arabia says it bombed Yemen’s port city of Mukalla over a shipment of weapons for a separatist force there that arrived from the United Arab Emirates

events.title: US removal of panels honoring Black soldiers at WWII cemetery draws backlash
events.description: The American Cemetery in the Dutch village of Margraten has become a flashpoint over the removal of displays honoring Black soldiers

events.title: Eurostar delays enter second day as passengers stuck onboard overnight
events.description: Eurostar says it plans to run all of its services on Wednesday but there may still be delays and cancellations.

events.title: Isiah Whitlock Jr: The Wire and Veep actor dies at 71
events.description: Whitlock was known for his notably elongated, profane catchphrase, which he used on The Wire and in films.

events.title: Thieves use drill to steal €30m in German bank heist
events.description: Gelsenkirchen Police say thieves used the "quiet" days after Christmas to break into the high street branch.

events.title: Israel to bar 37 aid groups from Gaza
events.description: The move was criticised by foreign ministers from from 10 countries including the UK, who said the new rules were "restrictive" and "unacceptable".

events.title: Bangladesh's first female prime minister Khaleda Zia dies aged 80
events.description: For decades, Zia and ousted PM Sheikh Hasina were bitter rivals - and their feud defined Bangladesh's politics.

events.title: Guinea junta chief wins presidency in controversial election
events.description: The victory, which gives the junta leader a seven-year mandate, was widely expected.

events.title: K-pop band member sued for $30m after bitter record label feud
events.description: Record label Ador says it has dropped NewJeans member Danielle Marsh while the return of Minji remains uncertain.

events.title: Great white sharks face extinction in Mediterranean, say researchers
events.description: Overfishing and illegal fishing are contributing to the loss of sharks, including great whites.

events.title: Spanish woman who found fame for botching fresco restoration dies
events.description: Cecilia Giménez's effort to restore the painting Ecce Homo earned the artwork the nickname "Monkey Christ".

events.title: Germany hunts Christmas thieves after Ocean’s Eleven-style bank heist
events.description: Police are searching for suspects after thieves stole cash, gold and jewels worth up to $105m.

events.title: Guinea coup leader Mamady Doumbouya wins presidential election
events.description: Doumbouya wins with 86.72 percent of the vote, an absolute majority, four years after he led a military takeover.

events.title: US and Ivory Coast sign $480m deal as part of ‘America First’ aid strategy
events.description: The Trump administration is forging bilateral deals with countries hit by widespread cuts to US foreign aid.

events.title: Will China use force against Taiwan?
events.description: Beijing has carried out its biggest-ever military drills off the self-governed island.

events.title: Senegal beat Benin to claim AFCON group, as DR Congo set up Algeria tie
events.description: Senegal beat Benin 3-0 to top AFCON 2025 group, while DR Congo beat Botswana, setting up a mouth-watering Algeria tie.

events.title: Burglars nab tens of millions in property from German bank
events.description: Footage shows a hole in the vault of Sparkasse Bank in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, where thieves made off with valuables.

events.title: Nigeria beat Uganda 3-1 to head into AFCON last 16 with perfect record
events.description: Elsewhere in Group C, Tanzania scrape through to the knockout stages for the first time after 1-1 draw with Tunisia.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: More than 3,000 migrants died trying to reach Spain in 2025
events.description: Tighter border controls caused arrivals to decline sharply but forced people on to more dangerous routes, activists say More than 3,000 people died trying to reach Spain by sea over the past year, a sharp fall from the previous 12 months. However, activists cautioned that the drop reflected tighter border controls that have forced migrants to take increasingly dangerous routes. Continue reading...

events.title: Opposition anger as Guinea’s junta leader is frontrunner to be elected president
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya accused of betraying his promise to be the restorer of democracy after leading 2021 coup In September 2021, a tall, young colonel in the Guinean army announced that he and his comrades had forcibly seized power and toppled the longtime leader Alpha Condé. “The will of the strongest has always supplanted the law,” Mamady Doumbouya said in a speech, stressing that the soldiers were acting to restore the will of the people. Continue reading...

events.title: Jair Bolsonaro undergoes second procedure to treat persistent hiccups
events.description: Former Brazilian president underwent a phrenic nerve block while temporarily released from prison for surgery Jair Bolsonaro underwent a second “phrenic nerve block procedure” on Monday to treat persistent hiccups. The treatment went well and the former Brazilian president’s condition is stable, according to his medical team. Continue reading...

events.title: Damien Martyn, former Australian Test cricketer, in hospital in induced coma with meningitis
events.description: 54-year-old admitted to hospital on Boxing Day with meningitis Martyn played 67 Tests for Australia between 1992 and 2006 The former Australian Test cricketer Damien Martyn has been admitted to hospital and placed in an induced coma after being diagnosed with meningitis. The sporting community is rallying around the 54-year-old, who “is in for the fight of his life”, according to the former AFL player Brad Hardie, who revealed Martyn’s condition on 6PR on Tuesday. Continue reading...

events.title: Coral Adventurer passengers return with diverging accounts of cruise ship drama
events.description: One passenger tells the ABC it was ‘chaos’ and she felt her life was in danger, but others shrug off the incident Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A passenger onboard the Coral Adventurer has told the ABC she won’t travel with the luxury cruise liner again, after it was grounded on a reef off Papua New Guinea at the weekend. Ursula Daus alleged her life was in “danger” as a result of the incident. But other passengers told the ABC their experience was more positive, after landing at Cairns airport on Tuesday . Continue reading...

events.title: M 6.6 - 31 km ESE of Yilan, Taiwan
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - VI DYFI? - VI Time 2025-12-27 15:05:56 UTC 2025-12-27 15:05:56 UTC at epicenter Location 24.657°N 122.041°E Depth 67.53 km (41.96 mi)

events.title: Israel says it will bar aid groups, including Doctors Without Borders, from Gaza
events.description: Israel accused Doctors Without Borders, one of the largest health organizations operating in Gaza, of failing to clarify the roles of some staff that Israel accused of cooperation with militants.

events.title: Former Israeli negotiator talks about the next phase of the Gaza peace plan
events.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks about the prospects for Phase Two of the Gaza peace plan with former Israeli negotiator Daniel Levy, president of the U.S./Middle East Project.

events.title: China conducting military drills around Taiwan, demonstrating blockade capabilities
events.description: China is conducting big military drills that encircle the island of Taiwan on Tuesday, demonstrating its ability to blockade Taiwan completely.

events.title: Guinea's junta leader declared winner of presidential election
events.description: Mamdi Doumbouya secured almost 87% of the vote, while several opposition figures were either barred from contesting or were in exile. Doumbouya seized power after staging a coup in 2021.

events.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK, dies aged 35
events.description: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed she had been diagnosed with a rare type of leukemia in an essay in The New Yorker last month. She was highly critical of her relative Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the US health secretary.

events.title: Fact check: The disinformation we debunked in 2025
events.description: From doctored images to fabricated stories, we uncovered the most viral fakes of 2025 — deepfakes, election myths and health hoaxes. Here's what dominated the disinformation landscape.

events.title: Female empowerment: Arab women rise to the mic
events.description: More and more Middle Eastern women thrive as comedians. Could their success on stage, in the film industry, at comedy festivals and on social media foster empowerment for the next generation of girls?

events.title: Japan's 'nengajo' New Year card tradition losing its charm
events.description: A Japanese year-end rite that can trace its roots back more than 1,000 years is disappearing as people have less free time, feel less connected to work colleagues and prefer to send New Year greetings via social media.

events.title: MH370 search resumes in Indian Ocean nearly 12 years after plane's disappearance
events.description: Nearly 12 years after Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 vanished with 239 people on board, a renewed search has begun in the remote southern Indian Ocean, as investigators deploy advanced deep-sea technology in a fresh bid to solve one of aviation’s most enduring mysteries.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Nigeria complete near-perfect group stage with third straight win
events.description: Nigeria have completed a near-perfect group stage after claiming a third straight win by beating Uganda 3-1.

events.title: French ban on ‘forever chemicals' in cosmetics and clothes to enter into force
events.description: A French ban on the production and sale of PFAS chemicals – known as 'forever chemicals' as it takes them so long to break down – comes into effect on Thursday. The ban targets a wide range of cosmetics and clothes and will also require French authorities to regularly test drinking water for all kinds of PFAS.

events.title: Passenger describes being stranded on Eurostar train overnight - as disruption continues
events.description: Passengers have been stuck on a Eurostar train for hours overnight, after the train network was forced to cancel large parts of its London-Europe service on Tuesday.

events.title: Israel suspends 37 aid organisations from operating in Gaza
events.description: Israel says it is suspending more than 30 humanitarian organisations, including Doctors Without Borders, from operating in Gaza for failing to comply with new registration rules.

events.title: Thieves drill into bank vault to steal valuables worth tens of millions of euros
events.description: Thieves have drilled into a German savings bank vault to steal millions of pounds worth of valuables from safety deposit boxes.

events.title: 'I have sunburn and whiplash after a head-spinning two days of Trump diplomacy... only one of them is his fault'
events.description: Two December days in Palm Beach and I have sunburn and whiplash.

events.title: Bangladesh's first female prime minister dies
events.description: Bangladesh's first female prime minister Khaleda Zia has died following a prolonged illness, her political party has said.

events.title: Khaleda Zia, former Bangladeshi prime minister and archrival of a previous premier, dies at 80
events.description: Former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has died at 80, her political party has announced Tuesday

events.title: China flexes blockade capabilities near Taiwan on second day of military drills
events.description: China's People's Liberation Army is conducting large-scale military drills around Taiwan as part of "Justice Mission 2025."

events.title: Italy's Parliament approves 2026 budget with deficit-cutting measures
events.description: Italy’s Parliament has approved the government’s 2026 budget, which includes deficit-cutting measures

events.title: Thieves drill into German bank vault, steal millions of euros worth of property
events.description: Police in Germany say thieves stole tens of millions of euros worth of property from safety deposit boxes inside a bank vault that they drilled into during the holiday lull

events.title: South Korea will end breeding of bears and extraction of their bile
events.description: South Korea says it will end its dwindling yet much-criticized bear bile farming industry

events.title: China's top diplomat blasts US arms sale to Taiwan as military drills unfold
events.description: China’s top diplomat has slammed a record U.S. military sale to Taiwan

events.title: Hungary's 'water guardian' farmers fight back against desertification
events.description: Southern Hungary landowner Oszkár Nagyapáti has been battling severe drought on his land

events.title: General Assembly approves $3.45 billion UN regular budget for 2026
events.description: The General Assembly has approved a $3.45 billion regular budget for the United Nations for 2026, following weeks of intensive negotiations and one of the Organization’s most important reform initiatives, UN80.

events.title: LIVE: General Assembly decides on 2026 UN budget
events.description: Follow our live coverage as the General Assembly and its Fifth Committee meet today to finalize negotiations and vote on the United Nations’ regular budget for 2026. The Fifth Committee is responsible for administrative and budgetary matters, including the Organization’s finances and staffing. UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Gaza: Humanitarian response ongoing despite restrictions
events.description: Although “significant restrictions and impediments” continue to hamper humanitarian operations in Gaza, teams are still responding to the population’s needs, the UN aid coordination office OCHA said on Wednesday.

events.title: Priest catches suspect breaking into church ‘poor box’ days before Christmas, police say
events.description: A priest caught a suspect breaking into a church "poor box" days before Christmas in Philadelphia. Police shared surveillance video of the incident.

events.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, JFK's granddaughter, dies at 35 after year-and-a-half leukemia battle
events.description: Environmental journalist Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of President John F. Kennedy and Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, passed away at 35 after battling acute myeloid leukemia.

events.title: Slender Man stabber Morgan Geyser ordered back to psychiatric hospital after group home escape
events.description: Judge orders Morgan Geyser back to psychiatric hospital after escaping group home. Woman convicted in 2014 Slender Man stabbing loses privileges.

events.title: Kentucky freight train carrying molten sulfur derails, leaks hazardous chemical in Todd County
events.description: Thirty-one freight train cars derailed in rural Todd County, Kentucky on Thursday, prompting a shelter-in-place after molten sulfur leaked from one car.

events.title: Unearthed video allegedly shows rampant Minnesota fraud and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Zelenskyy claims Trump said US will consider giving Ukraine decades of security guarantees
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy indicated that American President Donald Trump said the U.S. will entertain the prospect of providing Ukraine with decades of security guarantees.

events.title: UK prime minister slammed for welcoming home freed Egyptian prisoner after social media posts resurface
events.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer is facing criticism after welcoming human rights activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah home, as the man's past posts sparked political backlash.
